body:
Are we allowed to get inspiration or copy maps off of video game levels?
Such as: Mario, super smash bros, etc
body_tagged:
Are we allowed to get inspiration or copy maps off of video game levels?
Such as: Mario, super smash bros, etc
title: Question about the map making.

replies.body:
Of course!
Let your imagination run wild! Just don't copy the style of already released maps without permission ;D
.
replies.body_tagged:
Of course!
Let your imagination run wild! Just don't copy the style of already released maps without permission ;D
.

replies.body: There's nothing wrong with using the style of how a map is made from another map.
replies.body_tagged: There's nothing wrong with using the style of how a map is made from another map.

replies.body: Don't name your map after a video game, copyright issues may occur if the map where to be accepted.
replies.body_tagged: Don't name your map after a video game, copyright issues may occur if the map where to be accepted.

replies.body: So we are allowed to use levels from video games?

replies.body: Aw. I was gonna name my map starshine beach. But that's what the level is called :(
replies.body_tagged: Aw. I was gonna name my map starshine beach. But that's what the level is called :(

reply_to.body: Yep, just don't use the video game name :)
reply_to.body_tagged: Yep, just don't use the video game name :)

replies.body: Well actually, the level is called starshine beach galaxy. But it's still kinda similar
replies.body_tagged: Well actually, the level is called starshine beach galaxy. But it's still kinda similar

reply_to.body: Aw. I was gonna name my map starshine beach. But that's what the level is called :(
reply_to.body_tagged: Aw. I was gonna name my map starshine beach. But that's what the level is called :(

replies.body:
From Super Mario Galaxy 2? You have great taste.

Correct me if I'm wrong, but Star only said you can't use the name of the video game; he never mentioned the name of the level. Moreover, this page states that the title of a game is treated like its concept in the sense that it's too broad to be copyrighted. If that's the case, then I doubt something as petty as borrowing — for nonprofit purposes — the name "Starshine Beach" would raise any legal issues. What do you think?
replies.body_tagged:

If that's the case, then I doubt something as petty as borrowing — for nonprofit purposes — the name "Starshine Beach" would raise any legal issues. What do you think?
